name: io.bytes.per.checksum
description:
The number of bytes per checksum.  Must not be larger than
  io.file.buffer.size.

name: mapreduce.input.fileinputformat.list-status.num-threads
description:
The number of threads to use to list and fetch block locations
  for the specified input paths. Note: multiple threads should not be used
  if a custom non thread-safe path filter is used.

name: dfs.datanode.http.internal-proxy.port
description:
The datanode's internal web proxy port.
    By default it selects a random port available in runtime.

name: mapreduce.input.fileinputformat.split.minsize
description:
The minimum size chunk that map input should be split
  into.  Note that some file formats may have minimum split sizes that
  take priority over this setting.

name: dfs.client.mmap.cache.size
description:
When zero-copy reads are used, the DFSClient keeps a cache of recently used
    memory mapped regions.  This parameter controls the maximum number of
    entries that we will keep in that cache.

    The larger this number is, the more file descriptors we will potentially
    use for memory-mapped files.  mmaped files also use virtual address space.
    You may need to increase your ulimit virtual address space limits before
    increasing the client mmap cache size.

    Note that you can still do zero-copy reads when this size is set to 0.

name: dfs.namenode.lease-hard-limit-sec
description: Determines the namenode automatic lease recovery interval in seconds.
